question: Which country administers the “Marquesas Islands”?
explanation: The Marquesas Islands are a group of Volcanic Islands locates in the southern Pacific Ocean. These islands are under the administration of French Polynesia, an overseas collectivity of France. These islands are thought to have formed by a center of upwelling magma called the Marquesas Hotspot. It houses Marquesan Nature Reserves. These islands were once a major center of eastern Polynesian civilization.
